result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Decou Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: WITH HUBER PRIVILEGES and ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

miscConds.notes:
Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. IF NOT PAID, WILL CONVERT TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Pay COURT COSTS/OTHER SURCHARGES; IF NOT PAID, WILL CONVERT TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Make good faith effort to seek and maintain employment and job training.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Dated July 24, 2016 to the Court on behalf of Edward Jackson; Filed

Defendant Edward Decou Jackson in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter in court for Sentencing hearing. 
IT IS ORDERED: THE DEFENDANT IS SENTENCED TO THIRTY (30) DAYS. COURT STAYS SENTENCE AND ORDERS TWO (2) YEARS PROBATION WITH HUBER PRIVILEGES. 
IT IS ALSO ORDERED: ELECTRONIC MONITORING. 

Judgment of conviction entered.  
Firearms warning given. 
Voting admonishment given.  
DNA notification given. 
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. IF NOT PAID, WILL CONVERT TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Pay COURT COSTS/OTHER SURCHARGES; IF NOT PAID, WILL CONVERT TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Make good faith effort to seek and maintain employment and job training.

Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement; Filed
Notice of Rights to Seek Post Conviction Relief; Filed

Defendant Edward Decou Jackson in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Matter set for sentencing on August 5, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 18, Judge Colon's court.  

ALL PARTIES WERE ADVISED THAT AS OF AUGUST 1, 2016, THIS CASE WILL BE EASSIGNED TO JUDGE PEDRO COLON, BRANCH #18, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

FILED,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

**JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE CONEN**

Defendant Edward Decou Jackson in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for plea/sentencing.  Attorney Toran indicated he has had conversations with District Attorney John Chisholm regarding this case and requested an adjournment.  The Court passed this case to have ADA Kunisch speak with Mr. Chisholm.  CASE RECALLED AT 9:41AM.  Attorney Kunisch confirmed with DDA Kent Lovern that they are in discussions with Attorney Toran regarding this case but nothing has been finalized.  The Court granted ONE LAST ADJOURNMENT.  If not resolved by next court date, a jury trial date has to be set.  Matter set for plea/sentencing on June 21, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
